description: Single storey detached building at rear for use incidental to main dwelling
decision_conditions:
<div><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US" style="">The proposed outbuilding&nbsp;would result
in a visually dominant and overbearing form of development and would give rise
to a loss of outlook, light, overshadowing and actual and perceived
overlooking, to the detriment of the residential amenities of the occupiers of
No. 14 due to its siting along the boundary with No. 14 The Spinney, its
excessive height, scale and bulk, and the provision of windows within the rear
wall of the outbuilding. As such, the proposal is&nbsp;contrary to the National
Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 (7) of the London Plan (2021),
Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and
the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<font color="#231f20" face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="letter-spacing: -0.1pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></span></p></div><p><br data-cke-eol="1"></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US" style="">The proposed single storey outbuilding, by
reason of its siting, excessive height and overall scale and bulk would result
in an overly dominant and unduly obtrusive development, which would be harmful
to the character and appearance of the existing site and would fail to respect
the prevailing pattern of development in the area, contrary to the high quality
design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3
D (1) and D 3 D (11) of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow
Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary
Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<font color="#231f20" face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="letter-spacing: -0.1pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></span></p>
